newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesian rubber stable in late trade.
newsitem.headline: Indonesian rubber stable in late trade.

text.p: Indonesian tyre-grade SIR20 rubber prices were stable in late trading on Tuesday, with demand remaining thin, traders said.
Traders said a deal was done in the afternoon at 50.25 U.S. cents/lb fob Medan for June shipment. They said they did not hear of deals in other cities.
"I can't believe that a deal has been done in this kind of (weak market) situation," one trader said.
Traders said offer prices were stable at 50.50 fob Surabaya and Medan, 50.00 fob Palembang and 49.75 fob Padang.
Offer prices were unchanged fob Pontianak and Jambi at 49.50.
"There were some enquiries in Medan at 50.00 U.S. cents/lb. But traders did not want to sell because such prices are just too low," one trader said.
Traders said supply was tight in Medan due to wintering but it had not prompted buying interest as the supply situation in other growing areas were not affected.
They also said demand was poor because tyre makers in the United States already had sufficient stocks while others were waiting for values to decline further.
"This is a buyers' market. Buyers are controlling the market while we have to sell as we need the money," one trader said.
Traders said the poor market sentiment was also sparked by the decline in Japanese prices.
